p: This page lists some of the terms and abbreviations often used in Peppol. You can consider this an unofficial Peppol glossary. If you are missing a term drop me a note.

tr.td: A non-profit origanisation under Belgium law. See this page for details (in French).
The technical connector of a software solution that is capable of sending and/or receiving Peppol business documents

Transport protocol specified in RFC 4130. This was the default transport protocol until 2020-01-31. It was replaced with AS4. The usage of AS2 is supported until 2023-09-06 - see Transport Profiles Code List.

Transport protocol specified by OASIS. It was used in the eSENS project and adopted by CEF. The Peppol AS4 profile v2 is the mandatory transport protocol in the Peppol eDelivery network since 2020-02-01.
The document type for describing the non-functional aspects of a Peppol participant for listing in the PD. It is maintained decentralized in the SMP.

A Peppol created specification that define how a business document exchange should take place and how the UBL elements are bound to semantical elements. The most known BIS is "Peppol BIS Billing 3" which defines the exchange of invoices and credit notes.

Business document to be exchanged stating business level validation results (see also MLR). Peppol does not contain a single BLR - it contains different responses for different document types, like Order Response or Invoice Response. The usage of a BLR depends on the chosen "Process ID" which identifies the orchestration of message exchange to be used.
The "Sending End User" is Corner 1 in the 4 Corner Model.
The "Sending End User's Service Provider" is Corner 2 in the 4 Corner Model.
The "Receiving End User's Service Provider" is Corner 3 in the 4 Corner Model.
The "Receiving End User" is Corner 4 in the 4 Corner Model.
OpenPeppol internal community that is supposed to deal with cross-community topics.

An instrument of the EC for funding and informing about e-Delivery, e-Invoicing etc. solutions. See https://commission.europa.eu/funding-tenders/find-funding/eu-funding-programmes/connecting-europe-facility_en/. The successor of CEF is the DEP programme.
One of the two formats identified by the EN to be supported by public entities.
The previous Peppol reference implementation, superseded by CEF now maintained by EC. https://ec.europa.eu/digital-building-blocks/sites/display/DIGITAL/eDelivery.
Defines how to adopt the EN to local requirements. It implies, that a CIUS is more narrow then the underlying specification. Billing BIS 3 is a CIUS of the EN.
The Peppol internal team that makes decisions. There is one CMB for eDeC, PoAC and PrAC.
A specific DNS record type that uses a domain name as a value
Basic part of Internet technology that maps domain names to IP addresses for technical routing. Used by SML, SMP and AP.

The Digital Europe Programme (DIGITAL) is a new EU funding programme focused on bringing digital technology to businesses, citizens and public administrations. See https://digital-strategy.ec.europa.eu/en/activities/digital-programme.
Generic term for all entities directly or indirectly related to them (DG DIGIT etc.).
The successor of TICC within OpenPeppol. See https://peppol.org/learn-more/communities-and-work-groups/
Usually this refers to the EN 16931-1, the European Norm on e-Invoicing. Outside of the Peppol world a multitude of different ENs exist.
An OpenPeppol statistics report on the number of transmitted documents. See https://docs.peppol.eu/edelivery/specs/reporting/eusr/ for the specification. See also TSR.
This defines an event where people are meeting in real (face to face) and not just virtually in telephone conferences.
OpenPeppol internal document that provides rules and guidance on several topics.
Special BLR for invoices. Sometimes also called "IR" but that already has a different meaning.
Legacy Peppol transport protocol for pulling messages. Has been discontinued.
The technical receipt of acknowledgment for AS2 transmissions defined in RFC 3798. The equivalent in AS4 is a SignalMessage with a Receipt or an Error.
Working title for a work group that should deal with structured response messages. The outcome will be the MLS specification.
Business document to be exchanged stating technical validation results (see also BLR)
The proposed successor of the MLR specification maintained by eDEC. See https://docs.peppol.eu/edelivery/specs/mls/v1.0.0/ for the specification.
Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Standards
The organisation responsible for maintaining Peppol standards and running the transport infrastructure. See https://peppol.org/. See also AISBL.
A local authority managing and supporting the regional Service Providers. Jurisdictions not having their own PA, are managed and supported by OpenPeppol directly.
OpenPeppol internal group of Peppol Authorities.
The Peppol Authority that acts as the PA for all jurisdictions where none is defined. This role is fulfilled by OpenPeppol.
A central Peppol service that should help in mapping Peppol participant IDs to the participant names and countries. See https://docs.peppol.eu/edelivery for the specification.

This is the European project that initiated all this. Started as a European Large Scale Pilot and is now maintained by OpenPeppol AISBL. Since middle of 2019 the abbreviation was officially replaced with "Peppol" as a noun.
Peppol internal team to manage the post-award assets. See https://peppol.org/learn-more/communities-and-work-groups/
This is the technical identifier for the sender and receiver of a document exchange. This is also used in an SMP as a so called "service group".
Peppol internal team to manage the pre-award assets. See https://peppol.org/learn-more/communities-and-work-groups/
A generic XML envelope structure that defines a header (SBDH) and a payload. See also SBDH. See https://docs.peppol.eu/edelivery for the specification (Peppol Business Message Envelope).
The header part inside the SBD. See https://docs.peppol.eu/edelivery for the specification (Peppol Business Message Envelope).
Test version of the SML ('K' comes before 'L' like testing comes before production). Currently operated by EC. See https://docs.peppol.eu/edelivery for the specification.
Central Peppol service that modifies the DNS. Currently operated by EC. See https://docs.peppol.eu/edelivery for the specification.

Distributed Peppol registry. Used to lookup participant endpoint URLs. See https://docs.peppol.eu/edelivery for the specification. See https://github.com/phax/phoss-smp for an Open Source implementation.
A company or entity offering Peppol Services.
OpenPeppol internal group of Service Providers. See https://openpeppol.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPC/overview for details.
A specific identifier of a specific Peppol SP based on the SPIS.
An identifier Scheme to identify Peppol SPs for sole usage in the Peppol Network.
Legacy Peppol transport protocol, based on the Webservice stack. Was superseded by AS2.
Special team that takes care of the "Peppol Policy for the use of identifiers" as well as the codelists required for document exchange.
The contract between the Peppol user and the Peppol Authority. Since July 2022 this has been superseded by the "Peppol Agreement Framework".
Peppol internal team to manage the technical assets.Now called EDEC. See https://peppol.org/learn-more/communities-and-work-groups/.
An OpenPeppol statistics report on the number of transmitted documents. See https://docs.peppol.eu/edelivery/specs/reporting/tsr/ for the specification. See also EUSR.
An OASIS standard that defines certain XML based document types used in Peppol and the EN.
